intro: Bidens macroptera, commonly known as the largeleaf beggarlice, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces yellow flowers with ray florets. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in wet or dry conditions. Bidens macroptera is also known for its ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
